intro: Coelogyne glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, showy blooms. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, attaching itself to trees or rocks. Its leaves are usually broad and革质, while its flowers are often pink or white with a distinctive scent. Coelogyne glandulosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and is relatively easy to cultivate under the right conditions.
